pros: Good support, friendly, convenient for travelling
cons: Low salary, not much support for foreigners.

job_title: Research and Teaching Assistant in Madrid
pros: - They allowed me to face research problems, solution-oriented - Freedom to decide what to research
cons: - Low pay - Too many classes to take throughout the academic year

pros: Good enviroment with the colleagues
cons: Depends on the department you work in

review_title: Good, and relaxing place to work. Team build uo mentality should imprpve.
pros:
Relaxing working environment. Flexible working hours, adjustable schedules, +1hr of lunch break, lots of extra academical activities.

The university infrastructure and processes work well. As a staff member you have all tools (physical and software) that you need to perform your job.

Staff have good academic reputation and most of research is published in Q1 journals.

It is among the most international universities in Spain.
cons:
Little team build up mentality. Sometimes you can perceive distrust and individualism.

Salaries for PhD students are low and sometimes insufficient to cover basic expenses in a region like Madrid.

Academic staff is too academic and few people have industrial working experience and networking.

Too hierarchical. Don't expect to interact very much with fellows in upper floors of the academic pyramid.

pros: good environment, friendly, flexible, international
cons: low salary, not in the centre

pros: Great environment and efficient management
cons: Low wage for international standards, fair wage for European standards

review_title: Best university for your future but miserable salary
pros: Great professors to conduct your career into the academia with quite great international networking for your future opportunities.
cons:
Miserable salary: 1150€ net payment monthly for a full-time Ph.D. It is impossible to live in Madrid with that salary.
Moreover, these types of contracts do not allow you to work in another place at the same time therefore you are obligated to survive with 1150€.

pros: Flexibility in working schedules and vacation periods
cons: Low changes of promotion in the college

pros: Good work environment and a rewarding learning experience
cons: Pad bay for the amount of hours of work

pros: People in the business administration department are super nice. As a PhD student I received appropriate training and guidance in my academic development.
cons: There is nothing to complain really.

job_title: Profesor titular de universidad in Madrid
pros: International perspective; Research oriented; Great students
cons: Due to its mid size it does not appear very highly ranked in international rankings that benefit large universities

pros: Good facilities, infrastructure and services
cons: Low salaries, too much hierarchy in professorship

review_title: A great place to start and develop an academic career!
pros: Pretigious and internationally recognized institution.
cons: Campus is allocated far from the city center.

review_title: A good place to work with good conditions.
pros:
Many days of holidays and free days.
The people of the university (with some exceptions!).
Good working environment.
cons: Work peaks in some seasons.

pros: high job autonomy, international orientation
cons: Unfotrunately one must deal with Spanish bureaucracy,

pros: Flexible time, many resources available for research
cons: Lack of funding, research slowed due to too much bureaucracy

pros: competent, innovative, good schedule, international
cons: low salary, very focused on theory

pros: International work place and a good environment
cons: Nothing specific and significant at all

pros: A very nice and modern university
cons: More involvement of adjunct professors into the academic life would be appreciate

review_title: Nice job, but lots of teaching
pros: High flexibility for research topics
cons: A lot of teaching load

pros: Innovative team and very supportive people
cons: Limited career grow possibilities here

review_title: Good working environment, friendly people, but not such a great paycheck.
pros: You have the freedom to choose your schedule, noone keeps track of when you are in the office or not, as long as you finish the work you need to do (this is common in academia). Everyone (in your working group) is welcoming and try to make you feel integrated. The research done is high quality, you get to go to international conferences and have the oportunity to collaborate with other research centers.
cons:
The government is cutting a bit the research funding so the laboratories some times have it tough to get material, for theoriticians it does not make much difference though. With the friendlyness of the people comes their loudness, so if you are in an office with 5 other people it can get noisy some times.
When going to conferences, for justifying expenses, the paperwork can result a bit to much, so it just takes to be patient.

review_title: Good research, good conditions, small salary
pros: It is a relatively young University, so the staff is generally young and quite open minded (there's always exceptions). They provide enough media/instruments for research, don't expect the best though. The ratio of quality of life (time you get for yourself) to working hours is quite good.
cons: Sometimes things might go quite slow, there's a lot of bureaucracy that needs to be taken care of. Salary is small if you compare to other countries' standard, even taking in consideration the costs of life in Spain.

review_title: It was calm, well organized and nice
pros: It is very well organized and nice. People are lovely. Engineering campus is in Leganes which is a nice town near to Madrid. The campus is in the heart of town.
cons: Because of financial crisis, they have problem in renewing the contracts. The salaries were paid on time, but they even may offer a two-month extension of the contract.

review_title: It was a very pleasant experience.
pros:
Location - in a quiet suburb, yet only 20 minutes by train to the center.
Nice campus - has a great sports complex, between a big park and the town center.
Relatively cheap rent.
cons: Gets really hot in the summer.

pros: This Spanish university has great facilities and all that a professor needs to develop his or her activities.
cons: The permanency policy is odd, the rules to keep your position are fuzzy and have a high dependency on the politics.

pros: If you love what you are doing this is the best job. Flexible schedule, teaching other people, and a lot of research.
cons: Not everyone works hard. Teaching some times takes a lot time.

review_title: To be a PhD in UC3M
pros: Really dependent on the deparment, but flexibility, nice campus, people, etc
cons: Administrative staff is a pain in the neck and if you too much into "politics" you will hate it.

review_title: Reading a lot and publishing a much as you can.
pros: Good benefits regarding health and training courses.
cons: Monotony, not too much collaboration among groups and departments.

pros: It is a well equiped friendly encouragin university
cons: No employers that speak english at university except some professors

pros: flexible hours, technical innovation, good academic tracks
cons: slow development, low productivity, rigid burocracy

pros: Good life-work  balance and the working environment is also nice

as phd student sometime the stress is high.
The career opportunities when finished are limited.

pros: Everything is well organised, facilities, communications (bus, train, metro), the academic level is high, demanding.

pros: I am trying to expand the researches on the base of my Ph.D. thesis idea.
cons: This project will be finished by the end of October 2020.

cons: underpaid and lack of resources and access to databases

pros: Good benefits, good salary, a rather healthy work  environment
